title: Id this san serif
content:
Please ID the san serif font used in the Thrivent logo. Thanks

[https://www.thrivent.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20091121205346/https:/www.thrivent.com/ "https://www.thrivent.com")
author: dl

comments.content:
[Stone Sans Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20091121205346/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-stone-sans/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D66%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DThrivent%2520Financial%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D31) with a modified “v”.

If you need to recreate this logo you may just want to download this PDF with a vector version of the logo.

[https://www.thrivent.com/annuities/files/33019A\_Nov.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20091121205346/https:/www.thrivent.com/annuities/files/33019A_Nov.pdf "https://www.thrivent.com/annuities/files/33019A\_Nov.pdf")

Thanks so much for your help. I appreciate it. Actually, I only wanted to use the same type in another logo.

Plus, Thrivent has very strict guidelines about the use of their logo - understandably so. You need to obtain corporate approval.  
 [https://www.thrivent.com/aboutus/privacy/logo.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20091121205346/https:/www.thrivent.com/aboutus/privacy/logo.html "https://www.thrivent.com/aboutus/privacy/logo.html")
